title: On Cusp Of Third Term, Could Iraqi President Be A New Dictator?
teaser: In the first national election since U.S. troops withdrew in 2011, Iraqi Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki is the frontrunner for a third term in office. Despite criticism for mistreating the opposition and minority Sunnis, many say he's the man needed for Iraq's brutal situation.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
